intro: Leptalix cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf leptalix, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically opposite and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
